cluster_Security metrics
cluster_Quality assurance and quality control
cluster_This topic covers the avoidance and/or proper use of Fear Uncertainty, and Doubt (FUD) as a tool for awareness

cluster_This topic includes physical security; desktop security; password security; wireless networks; security phishing; file sharing and copyright; browsing; encryption; insider threat; international travel; social networking and social engineering
cluster_Security hiring practices
cluster_Security termination practices
cluster_Third-party security
cluster_Security in review processes
cluster_Special issue in privacy of employee personal information
cluster_Risk identification
g.text: Risk identification

g.title: Risk identification_Asset identification is the cataloging of information assets in an organization, such as databases or hardware, to aid in the determination of risk should the assets be compromised or lost. Threats include any event leveraging a vulnerability that has the potential to cause loss or damage for the organization. Threat intelligence (threat modeling) is increasingly used by organizations to maintain awareness and reactive capacity for existing and emerging threats
g.text: Asset identification is the cataloging of information assets in an organization, such as databases or hardware, to aid in the determination of risk should the assets be compromised or lost. Threats include any event leveraging a vulnerability that has the potential to cause loss or damage for the organization. Threat intelligence (threat modeling) is increasingly used by organizations to maintain awareness and reactive capacity for existing and emerging threats

g.title: cluster_Risk identification->Risk identification_Asset identification is the cataloging of information assets in an organization, such as databases or hardware, to aid in the determination of risk should the assets be compromised or lost. Threats include any event leveraging a vulnerability that has the potential to cause loss or damage for the organization. Threat intelligence (threat modeling) is increasingly used by organizations to maintain awareness and reactive capacity for existing and emerging threats
cluster_Risk assessment and analysis
g.text: Risk assessment and analysis

g.title: Risk assessment and analysis_Risk analysis is the organizational process to determine and deal with possible accidental or intentional losses, and designing and implementing procedures to minimize the impact of these losses. This can also encompass Threat Analysis and Threat Intelligence
g.text: Risk analysis is the organizational process to determine and deal with possible accidental or intentional losses, and designing and implementing procedures to minimize the impact of these losses. This can also encompass Threat Analysis and Threat Intelligence

g.title: cluster_Risk assessment and analysis->Risk assessment and analysis_Risk analysis is the organizational process to determine and deal with possible accidental or intentional losses, and designing and implementing procedures to minimize the impact of these losses. This can also encompass Threat Analysis and Threat Intelligence
cluster_Insider threats
g.text: Insider threats

g.title: Insider threats_This topic covers malicious human behavioral factors that might cause harm as a result of a conscious violation of trust, or best-use, or inadvertent error
g.text: This topic covers malicious human behavioral factors that might cause harm as a result of a conscious violation of trust, or best-use, or inadvertent error

g.title: cluster_Insider threats->Insider threats_This topic covers malicious human behavioral factors that might cause harm as a result of a conscious violation of trust, or best-use, or inadvertent error
Insider threats_An insider is defined as any person with authorized access to an organization’s resources including personnel, facilities, information, equipment, networks, and systems
g.text: An insider is defined as any person with authorized access to an organization’s resources including personnel, facilities, information, equipment, networks, and systems

g.title: cluster_Insider threats->Insider threats_An insider is defined as any person with authorized access to an organization’s resources including personnel, facilities, information, equipment, networks, and systems

Insider threats_An insider threat is defined as the risk that an insider will use their authorized access, wittingly or unwittingly, to do harm to their organization. This can include theft of proprietary information and technology; damage to company facilities, systems, or equipment; actual or threatened harm to employees; or, other actions that would prevent the company from carrying out its normal business practices
g.text: An insider threat is defined as the risk that an insider will use their authorized access, wittingly or unwittingly, to do harm to their organization. This can include theft of proprietary information and technology; damage to company facilities, systems, or equipment; actual or threatened harm to employees; or, other actions that would prevent the company from carrying out its normal business practices

g.title: cluster_Insider threats->Insider threats_An insider threat is defined as the risk that an insider will use their authorized access, wittingly or unwittingly, to do harm to their organization. This can include theft of proprietary information and technology; damage to company facilities, systems, or equipment; actual or threatened harm to employees; or, other actions that would prevent the company from carrying out its normal business practices
Insider threats_This topic covers motive-means-opportunity behaviors- motivation and discipline factors, accountability, awareness and quality control
g.text: This topic covers motive-means-opportunity behaviors- motivation and discipline factors, accountability, awareness and quality control

g.title: cluster_Insider threats->Insider threats_This topic covers motive-means-opportunity behaviors- motivation and discipline factors, accountability, awareness and quality control
Insider threats_The FBI has developed materials including indicators useful in identifying potential insider threat risks
g.text: The FBI has developed materials including indicators useful in identifying potential insider threat risks

g.title: cluster_Insider threats->Insider threats_The FBI has developed materials including indicators useful in identifying potential insider threat risks
cluster_Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies
g.text: Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies

g.title: Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies_Risk models are used to explain how assets encounter risk. In addition, there a number of industry-accepted methodologies to measure, evaluate, and communicate risk to stakeholders
g.text: Risk models are used to explain how assets encounter risk. In addition, there a number of industry-accepted methodologies to measure, evaluate, and communicate risk to stakeholders

g.title: cluster_Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies->Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies_Risk models are used to explain how assets encounter risk. In addition, there a number of industry-accepted methodologies to measure, evaluate, and communicate risk to stakeholders

Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies_This topic includes both quantitative and qualitative approaches to risk assessment, application of models and methods for various business contexts (e.g., HIPAA for healthcare facilities). Tools of interest might include the Cyber Resilience Review self-assessment, Cybersecurity Evaluation Tool (CSET) as well as Security Risk Assessment tool from HSS
g.text: This topic includes both quantitative and qualitative approaches to risk assessment, application of models and methods for various business contexts (e.g., HIPAA for healthcare facilities). Tools of interest might include the Cyber Resilience Review self-assessment, Cybersecurity Evaluation Tool (CSET) as well as Security Risk Assessment tool from HSS

g.title: cluster_Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies->Risk measurement and evaluation models and methodologies_This topic includes both quantitative and qualitative approaches to risk assessment, application of models and methods for various business contexts (e.g., HIPAA for healthcare facilities). Tools of interest might include the Cyber Resilience Review self-assessment, Cybersecurity Evaluation Tool (CSET) as well as Security Risk Assessment tool from HSS
cluster_Risk control
g.text: Risk control

g.title: Risk control_Risk control is defined as the act of lessening the consequences of a cyber event, and as a result lessening the amount of risk. Each approach should include the means to communicate risk to decision makers including the residual risk. Topics covered should include assessment and ranking of risk and the Avoid, Reduce, Transfer, Accept categories
g.text: Risk control is defined as the act of lessening the consequences of a cyber event, and as a result lessening the amount of risk. Each approach should include the means to communicate risk to decision makers including the residual risk. Topics covered should include assessment and ranking of risk and the Avoid, Reduce, Transfer, Accept categories

g.title: cluster_Risk control->Risk control_Risk control is defined as the act of lessening the consequences of a cyber event, and as a result lessening the amount of risk. Each approach should include the means to communicate risk to decision makers including the residual risk. Topics covered should include assessment and ranking of risk and the Avoid, Reduce, Transfer, Accept categories
Risk control_Curricular content should include widely-used risk control methodologies that are available for exposure and practice
g.text: Curricular content should include widely-used risk control methodologies that are available for exposure and practice

g.title: cluster_Risk control->Risk control_Curricular content should include widely-used risk control methodologies that are available for exposure and practice
cluster_Organizational context
g.text: Organizational context

g.title: Organizational context_Many factors influence how security is operationalized in organizations. These contexts are critical when designing a curriculum and should inform the entire process
g.text: Many factors influence how security is operationalized in organizations. These contexts are critical when designing a curriculum and should inform the entire process

g.title: cluster_Organizational context->Organizational context_Many factors influence how security is operationalized in organizations. These contexts are critical when designing a curriculum and should inform the entire process

Organizational context_This topic covers how internal versus external contextual differences have a major impact on the coverage of policy, regulation, and statute (or jurisdiction). Also, location- or country-specific issues and concerns should be evaluated. Applicable standards and guidelines for compliance to industry/sector should also be evaluated
g.text: This topic covers how internal versus external contextual differences have a major impact on the coverage of policy, regulation, and statute (or jurisdiction). Also, location- or country-specific issues and concerns should be evaluated. Applicable standards and guidelines for compliance to industry/sector should also be evaluated

g.title: cluster_Organizational context->Organizational context_This topic covers how internal versus external contextual differences have a major impact on the coverage of policy, regulation, and statute (or jurisdiction). Also, location- or country-specific issues and concerns should be evaluated. Applicable standards and guidelines for compliance to industry/sector should also be evaluated

Organizational context_The variance between governments versus private organizations is a factor as is the need to include international aspects including but not limited to import/export restrictions. Further, there is significant difference between organizations in various business vertical industry segments such as energy versus agriculture
g.text: The variance between governments versus private organizations is a factor as is the need to include international aspects including but not limited to import/export restrictions. Further, there is significant difference between organizations in various business vertical industry segments such as energy versus agriculture

g.title: cluster_Organizational context->Organizational context_The variance between governments versus private organizations is a factor as is the need to include international aspects including but not limited to import/export restrictions. Further, there is significant difference between organizations in various business vertical industry segments such as energy versus agriculture
cluster_Privacy
g.text: Privacy

g.title: Privacy_Privacy is a concept with cultural and national variations in its definition. At its core, privacy is based on the right to be forgotten, and various levels of choice and consent for the collection, use, and distribution of an individual’s information
g.text: Privacy is a concept with cultural and national variations in its definition. At its core, privacy is based on the right to be forgotten, and various levels of choice and consent for the collection, use, and distribution of an individual’s information

g.title: cluster_Privacy->Privacy_Privacy is a concept with cultural and national variations in its definition. At its core, privacy is based on the right to be forgotten, and various levels of choice and consent for the collection, use, and distribution of an individual’s information

Privacy_This topic addresses social and localized variances in privacy. Jurisdictional variance in privacy definitions should be explored. The relationships between individuals, organizations, or governmental privacy requirements should also be addressed. The impact of privacy settings in new tools/software, identifying a need for tools and techniques to be covered in most areas
g.text: This topic addresses social and localized variances in privacy. Jurisdictional variance in privacy definitions should be explored. The relationships between individuals, organizations, or governmental privacy requirements should also be addressed. The impact of privacy settings in new tools/software, identifying a need for tools and techniques to be covered in most areas

g.title: cluster_Privacy->Privacy_This topic addresses social and localized variances in privacy. Jurisdictional variance in privacy definitions should be explored. The relationships between individuals, organizations, or governmental privacy requirements should also be addressed. The impact of privacy settings in new tools/software, identifying a need for tools and techniques to be covered in most areas
Privacy_Additional consideration should be given to privacy in the context of consumer protection and health care regulations
g.text: Additional consideration should be given to privacy in the context of consumer protection and health care regulations

g.title: cluster_Privacy->Privacy_Additional consideration should be given to privacy in the context of consumer protection and health care regulations
Privacy_Organizations with international engagement must consider variances in privacy laws, regulations, and standards across the jurisdictions in which they operate
g.text: Organizations with international engagement must consider variances in privacy laws, regulations, and standards across the jurisdictions in which they operate

g.title: cluster_Privacy->Privacy_Organizations with international engagement must consider variances in privacy laws, regulations, and standards across the jurisdictions in which they operate
cluster_Laws, ethics, and compliance
g.text: Laws, ethics, and compliance

g.title: Laws, ethics, and compliance_Laws, regulations, standards as well as ethical values are derived from the social context and how organizations meet requirements to comply with them
g.text: Laws, regulations, standards as well as ethical values are derived from the social context and how organizations meet requirements to comply with them

g.title: cluster_Laws, ethics, and compliance->Laws, ethics, and compliance_Laws, regulations, standards as well as ethical values are derived from the social context and how organizations meet requirements to comply with them

Laws, ethics, and compliance_This topic includes how laws and technology intersect in the context of the judicial structures that are presentinternational, national and local - as organizations safeguard information systems from cyberattacks
g.text: This topic includes how laws and technology intersect in the context of the judicial structures that are presentinternational, national and local - as organizations safeguard information systems from cyberattacks

g.title: cluster_Laws, ethics, and compliance->Laws, ethics, and compliance_This topic includes how laws and technology intersect in the context of the judicial structures that are presentinternational, national and local - as organizations safeguard information systems from cyberattacks
Laws, ethics, and compliance_Ethical instruction should also be an element
g.text: Ethical instruction should also be an element

g.title: cluster_Laws, ethics, and compliance->Laws, ethics, and compliance_Ethical instruction should also be an element

Laws, ethics, and compliance_Professional codes of conduct and ethical standards should be addressed. Compliance efforts should include those efforts to conform to laws, regulations, and standards, and to include breach notification requirements by state, national, and international governing authorities. Examples of international laws and standards include GDPR and ISO/IEC 27000 et al. National laws of importance for U.S. organizations include HIPAA, Sarbanes-Oxley, GLBA, etc
g.text: Professional codes of conduct and ethical standards should be addressed. Compliance efforts should include those efforts to conform to laws, regulations, and standards, and to include breach notification requirements by state, national, and international governing authorities. Examples of international laws and standards include GDPR and ISO/IEC 27000 et al. National laws of importance for U.S. organizations include HIPAA, Sarbanes-Oxley, GLBA, etc

g.title: cluster_Laws, ethics, and compliance->Laws, ethics, and compliance_Professional codes of conduct and ethical standards should be addressed. Compliance efforts should include those efforts to conform to laws, regulations, and standards, and to include breach notification requirements by state, national, and international governing authorities. Examples of international laws and standards include GDPR and ISO/IEC 27000 et al. National laws of importance for U.S. organizations include HIPAA, Sarbanes-Oxley, GLBA, etc
cluster_Security governance
g.text: Security governance

g.title: Security governance_The principles of corporate governance are applicable to the information security function. Governance is the responsibility of the senior management of an organization to assure the effective implementation of strategic planning, risk management, and regulatory compliance usually by means of comprehensive managerial policy, plans, programs, and budgetary controls to secure the information of the organization
g.text: The principles of corporate governance are applicable to the information security function. Governance is the responsibility of the senior management of an organization to assure the effective implementation of strategic planning, risk management, and regulatory compliance usually by means of comprehensive managerial policy, plans, programs, and budgetary controls to secure the information of the organization

g.title: cluster_Security governance->Security governance_The principles of corporate governance are applicable to the information security function. Governance is the responsibility of the senior management of an organization to assure the effective implementation of strategic planning, risk management, and regulatory compliance usually by means of comprehensive managerial policy, plans, programs, and budgetary controls to secure the information of the organization

Security governance_This topic should frame the implementation of security governance and policy within global, national, and local laws, regulations and standards, and programs of instruction should seek to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples
g.text: This topic should frame the implementation of security governance and policy within global, national, and local laws, regulations and standards, and programs of instruction should seek to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples

g.title: cluster_Security governance->Security governance_This topic should frame the implementation of security governance and policy within global, national, and local laws, regulations and standards, and programs of instruction should seek to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples
cluster_Executive and board level communication
g.text: Executive and board level communication

g.title: Executive and board level communication_Delivering information to executives and external decision makers is a critical skill for information security leaders
g.text: Delivering information to executives and external decision makers is a critical skill for information security leaders

g.title: cluster_Executive and board level communication->Executive and board level communication_Delivering information to executives and external decision makers is a critical skill for information security leaders
Executive and board level communication_This topic includes communication skills that are taught and practiced with rehearsals that include critical analysis and meaningful feedback
g.text: This topic includes communication skills that are taught and practiced with rehearsals that include critical analysis and meaningful feedback

g.title: cluster_Executive and board level communication->Executive and board level communication_This topic includes communication skills that are taught and practiced with rehearsals that include critical analysis and meaningful feedback
cluster_Managerial policy
g.text: Managerial policy

g.title: Managerial policy_Organizational guidelines that dictate certain behavior within an organization
g.text: Organizational guidelines that dictate certain behavior within an organization

g.title: cluster_Managerial policy->Managerial policy_Organizational guidelines that dictate certain behavior within an organization

Managerial policy_This topic content should seeks to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples including security program policy, issue-specific policy and systemspecific policy as per NIST SP 800-12 Rev 1. This should also cover an understanding of the security policy development cycle, from initial research to implementation and maintenance, as well as giving exposure to real-world examples of security policies and practices
g.text: This topic content should seeks to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples including security program policy, issue-specific policy and systemspecific policy as per NIST SP 800-12 Rev 1. This should also cover an understanding of the security policy development cycle, from initial research to implementation and maintenance, as well as giving exposure to real-world examples of security policies and practices

g.title: cluster_Managerial policy->Managerial policy_This topic content should seeks to convey the concepts with clarity and sound examples including security program policy, issue-specific policy and systemspecific policy as per NIST SP 800-12 Rev 1. This should also cover an understanding of the security policy development cycle, from initial research to implementation and maintenance, as well as giving exposure to real-world examples of security policies and practices
cluster_Performance measurements (metrics)
g.text: Performance measurements (metrics)

g.title: Performance measurements (metrics)_A process of designing, implementing, and managing the use of specific measurements to determine the effectiveness of the overall security program. Built on metrics, a term used to describe any detailed statistical analysis technique on performance, but now commonly synonymous with performance measurement
g.text: A process of designing, implementing, and managing the use of specific measurements to determine the effectiveness of the overall security program. Built on metrics, a term used to describe any detailed statistical analysis technique on performance, but now commonly synonymous with performance measurement

g.title: cluster_Performance measurements (metrics)->Performance measurements (metrics)_A process of designing, implementing, and managing the use of specific measurements to determine the effectiveness of the overall security program. Built on metrics, a term used to describe any detailed statistical analysis technique on performance, but now commonly synonymous with performance measurement
Performance measurements (metrics)_Curricular content should include approaches and techniques to define and evaluate the utility of performance measurements should be explained to students
g.text: Curricular content should include approaches and techniques to define and evaluate the utility of performance measurements should be explained to students

g.title: cluster_Performance measurements (metrics)->Performance measurements (metrics)_Curricular content should include approaches and techniques to define and evaluate the utility of performance measurements should be explained to students
cluster_Data analytics
g.text: Data analytics

g.title: Data analytics_Data analytics is a set of techniques used to manipulate (often) large volumes of data to recognize, block, divert, and respond to cyberattacks. Monitoring real-time network activities enables agile decision making, detection of suspected malicious activities, utilization of a real-time visualization dashboard, and employment of a set of hardware and software to manage such detected suspicious activities
g.text: Data analytics is a set of techniques used to manipulate (often) large volumes of data to recognize, block, divert, and respond to cyberattacks. Monitoring real-time network activities enables agile decision making, detection of suspected malicious activities, utilization of a real-time visualization dashboard, and employment of a set of hardware and software to manage such detected suspicious activities

g.title: cluster_Data analytics->Data analytics_Data analytics is a set of techniques used to manipulate (often) large volumes of data to recognize, block, divert, and respond to cyberattacks. Monitoring real-time network activities enables agile decision making, detection of suspected malicious activities, utilization of a real-time visualization dashboard, and employment of a set of hardware and software to manage such detected suspicious activities

Data analytics_This topic includes definitions; the differences between security control and security analytic software and tools; the type and classifications of analytic tools and techniques (with examples such as OpenSOC); collect, filter, integrate and link diverse types of security event information; how security analytics tools work; the relationship between analytic software and tools and forensics; differences between forensic tools and analytic tool; network forensics (to include packet analysis, tools, Windows, Linux, UNIX, Mobile); differences between cyber forensics (social media for example) and network forensics
g.text: This topic includes definitions; the differences between security control and security analytic software and tools; the type and classifications of analytic tools and techniques (with examples such as OpenSOC); collect, filter, integrate and link diverse types of security event information; how security analytics tools work; the relationship between analytic software and tools and forensics; differences between forensic tools and analytic tool; network forensics (to include packet analysis, tools, Windows, Linux, UNIX, Mobile); differences between cyber forensics (social media for example) and network forensics

g.title: cluster_Data analytics->Data analytics_This topic includes definitions; the differences between security control and security analytic software and tools; the type and classifications of analytic tools and techniques (with examples such as OpenSOC); collect, filter, integrate and link diverse types of security event information; how security analytics tools work; the relationship between analytic software and tools and forensics; differences between forensic tools and analytic tool; network forensics (to include packet analysis, tools, Windows, Linux, UNIX, Mobile); differences between cyber forensics (social media for example) and network forensics
cluster_Security intelligence
g.text: Security intelligence

g.title: Security intelligence_Collection, analysis, and dissemination of security information including but not limited to threats and adversary capabilities
g.text: Collection, analysis, and dissemination of security information including but not limited to threats and adversary capabilities

g.title: cluster_Security intelligence->Security intelligence_Collection, analysis, and dissemination of security information including but not limited to threats and adversary capabilities

Security intelligence_In this topic, tools and techniques should be explored to include data collection and aggregation, data mining, data analytics, statistical analysis. Examples of sources for security intelligence include SIEM for internal data, and public and private intelligence services for external data. Dissemination includes an understanding of the Information Sharing and Analysis Center approach as well organizations like InfraGard
g.text: In this topic, tools and techniques should be explored to include data collection and aggregation, data mining, data analytics, statistical analysis. Examples of sources for security intelligence include SIEM for internal data, and public and private intelligence services for external data. Dissemination includes an understanding of the Information Sharing and Analysis Center approach as well organizations like InfraGard

g.title: cluster_Security intelligence->Security intelligence_In this topic, tools and techniques should be explored to include data collection and aggregation, data mining, data analytics, statistical analysis. Examples of sources for security intelligence include SIEM for internal data, and public and private intelligence services for external data. Dissemination includes an understanding of the Information Sharing and Analysis Center approach as well organizations like InfraGard
cluster_Systems Administration
g.text: Systems Administration

g.title: Systems Administration_System administration works behind the scenes to configure, operate, maintain, and troubleshoot the technical system infrastructure that supports much of modern life
g.text: System administration works behind the scenes to configure, operate, maintain, and troubleshoot the technical system infrastructure that supports much of modern life

g.title: cluster_Systems Administration->Systems Administration_System administration works behind the scenes to configure, operate, maintain, and troubleshoot the technical system infrastructure that supports much of modern life
Systems Administration_Prerequisite knowledge- Basic understanding of computer systems (Windows/Linux), networks (OSI Model), software, and database (Oracle/SQL)
g.text: Prerequisite knowledge- Basic understanding of computer systems (Windows/Linux), networks (OSI Model), software, and database (Oracle/SQL)

g.title: cluster_Systems Administration->Systems Administration_Prerequisite knowledge- Basic understanding of computer systems (Windows/Linux), networks (OSI Model), software, and database (Oracle/SQL)
cluster_Operating system administration
g.text: Operating system administration

g.title: Operating system administration_This topic covers the upkeep, reliable operation, configuration, and troubleshooting of technical systems, especially multi-user systems and servers
g.text: This topic covers the upkeep, reliable operation, configuration, and troubleshooting of technical systems, especially multi-user systems and servers

g.title: cluster_Operating system administration->Operating system administration_This topic covers the upkeep, reliable operation, configuration, and troubleshooting of technical systems, especially multi-user systems and servers

Operating system administration_This topic includes but not be limited to account management, disk administrations, system process administration, system task automation, performance monitoring, optimization, administration of tools for security and backup of disks and process
g.text: This topic includes but not be limited to account management, disk administrations, system process administration, system task automation, performance monitoring, optimization, administration of tools for security and backup of disks and process

g.title: cluster_Operating system administration->Operating system administration_This topic includes but not be limited to account management, disk administrations, system process administration, system task automation, performance monitoring, optimization, administration of tools for security and backup of disks and process
cluster_Database system administration
g.text: Database system administration

g.title: Database system administration_This topic covers managing and maintaining databases by utilizing available and applicable management system software
g.text: This topic covers managing and maintaining databases by utilizing available and applicable management system software

g.title: cluster_Database system administration->Database system administration_This topic covers managing and maintaining databases by utilizing available and applicable management system software

Database system administration_This topic includes but not be limited to installation and configuration of database servers, creation and manipulation of schemas, tables, indexes, views, constraints, stored procedures, functions, user account creation and administration, and tools for database backup and recovery. Coverage should include the data storage technologies in wide use as well as emerging data management technologies
g.text: This topic includes but not be limited to installation and configuration of database servers, creation and manipulation of schemas, tables, indexes, views, constraints, stored procedures, functions, user account creation and administration, and tools for database backup and recovery. Coverage should include the data storage technologies in wide use as well as emerging data management technologies

g.title: cluster_Database system administration->Database system administration_This topic includes but not be limited to installation and configuration of database servers, creation and manipulation of schemas, tables, indexes, views, constraints, stored procedures, functions, user account creation and administration, and tools for database backup and recovery. Coverage should include the data storage technologies in wide use as well as emerging data management technologies
cluster_Network administration
g.text: Network administration

g.title: Network administration_Network administration relates to installation, and supporting various network system architectures (LANs, WANs, MANs, intranets, extranets, perimeter networks
g.text: Network administration relates to installation, and supporting various network system architectures (LANs, WANs, MANs, intranets, extranets, perimeter networks

g.title: cluster_Network administration->Network administration_Network administration relates to installation, and supporting various network system architectures (LANs, WANs, MANs, intranets, extranets, perimeter networks
Network administration_This topic includes but is not limited to the OSI Model, securing of network traffic, and tools for configuration of services
g.text: This topic includes but is not limited to the OSI Model, securing of network traffic, and tools for configuration of services

g.title: cluster_Network administration->Network administration_This topic includes but is not limited to the OSI Model, securing of network traffic, and tools for configuration of services
cluster_Cloud administration
g.text: Cloud administration

g.title: Cloud administration_Cloud administration refers to the upkeep and reliable access to a dynamic pool of configurable remote resources (e.g., networks, servers, storage, applications and services) that can be rapidly configured, provisioned and released with minimal oversight
g.text: Cloud administration refers to the upkeep and reliable access to a dynamic pool of configurable remote resources (e.g., networks, servers, storage, applications and services) that can be rapidly configured, provisioned and released with minimal oversight

g.title: cluster_Cloud administration->Cloud administration_Cloud administration refers to the upkeep and reliable access to a dynamic pool of configurable remote resources (e.g., networks, servers, storage, applications and services) that can be rapidly configured, provisioned and released with minimal oversight

Cloud administration_This topic includes but is not limited to configuring and deploying applications and users in cloud infrastructures, analyzing performance, resource scaling, availability of cloud platforms, identifying security and privacy issues and mitigating risks
g.text: This topic includes but is not limited to configuring and deploying applications and users in cloud infrastructures, analyzing performance, resource scaling, availability of cloud platforms, identifying security and privacy issues and mitigating risks

g.title: cluster_Cloud administration->Cloud administration_This topic includes but is not limited to configuring and deploying applications and users in cloud infrastructures, analyzing performance, resource scaling, availability of cloud platforms, identifying security and privacy issues and mitigating risks
cluster_Cyber-physical system administration
g.text: Cyber-physical system administration

g.title: Cyber-physical system administration_Cyber-physical systems (CPS) are engineered systems that are built from, and depend upon, the seamless integration of computational algorithms and physical components. CPS administration refers to installation and upkeep by ensuring safety, capability, adaptability, scalability, resiliency, security, and usability
g.text: Cyber-physical systems (CPS) are engineered systems that are built from, and depend upon, the seamless integration of computational algorithms and physical components. CPS administration refers to installation and upkeep by ensuring safety, capability, adaptability, scalability, resiliency, security, and usability

g.title: cluster_Cyber-physical system administration->Cyber-physical system administration_Cyber-physical systems (CPS) are engineered systems that are built from, and depend upon, the seamless integration of computational algorithms and physical components. CPS administration refers to installation and upkeep by ensuring safety, capability, adaptability, scalability, resiliency, security, and usability

Cyber-physical system administration_This topic includes but is not limited to the architecture of cyber-physical systems, underlying communication standards (Zigbee), middleware, service-oriented architecture, tools supporting real-time control and application of real-world examples (power grid, nuclear facility, IoT, SCADA)
g.text: This topic includes but is not limited to the architecture of cyber-physical systems, underlying communication standards (Zigbee), middleware, service-oriented architecture, tools supporting real-time control and application of real-world examples (power grid, nuclear facility, IoT, SCADA)

g.title: cluster_Cyber-physical system administration->Cyber-physical system administration_This topic includes but is not limited to the architecture of cyber-physical systems, underlying communication standards (Zigbee), middleware, service-oriented architecture, tools supporting real-time control and application of real-world examples (power grid, nuclear facility, IoT, SCADA)
cluster_System hardening
g.text: System hardening

g.title: System hardening_This topic covers securing a system by finding and remediating risks. This may include hardening or securing configuration, system software, firmware, and application
g.text: This topic covers securing a system by finding and remediating risks. This may include hardening or securing configuration, system software, firmware, and application

g.title: cluster_System hardening->System hardening_This topic covers securing a system by finding and remediating risks. This may include hardening or securing configuration, system software, firmware, and application

System hardening_This topic includes but is not limited to identifying risks, threats, and vulnerabilities in commonly used systems (operating systems, database systems, networks); defining and administering procedures and practices to safeguard against threats; hardening through suitable tools (firewall, anti-virus, IDS, honeypot)
g.text: This topic includes but is not limited to identifying risks, threats, and vulnerabilities in commonly used systems (operating systems, database systems, networks); defining and administering procedures and practices to safeguard against threats; hardening through suitable tools (firewall, anti-virus, IDS, honeypot)

g.title: cluster_System hardening->System hardening_This topic includes but is not limited to identifying risks, threats, and vulnerabilities in commonly used systems (operating systems, database systems, networks); defining and administering procedures and practices to safeguard against threats; hardening through suitable tools (firewall, anti-virus, IDS, honeypot)
cluster_Availability
g.text: Availability

g.title: Availability_Sound system operation requires all systems sustain targeted levels of availability by having their current state recoverable from failure through redundancy and backup and recovery
g.text: Sound system operation requires all systems sustain targeted levels of availability by having their current state recoverable from failure through redundancy and backup and recovery

g.title: cluster_Availability->Availability_Sound system operation requires all systems sustain targeted levels of availability by having their current state recoverable from failure through redundancy and backup and recovery
Availability_This topic includes but is not limited to identifying key assets and administering tools to have validated system backup and recovery
g.text: This topic includes but is not limited to identifying key assets and administering tools to have validated system backup and recovery

g.title: cluster_Availability->Availability_This topic includes but is not limited to identifying key assets and administering tools to have validated system backup and recovery
cluster_Strategic planning
g.text: Strategic planning

g.title: Strategic planning_The process of defining an organization’s cybersecurity strategy - or direction - and determining the actions needed and resources to be allocated in order to implement such a strategy
g.text: The process of defining an organization’s cybersecurity strategy - or direction - and determining the actions needed and resources to be allocated in order to implement such a strategy

g.title: cluster_Strategic planning->Strategic planning_The process of defining an organization’s cybersecurity strategy - or direction - and determining the actions needed and resources to be allocated in order to implement such a strategy

Strategic planning_This topic covers concepts such as determining the current organization’s position; performing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats (SWOT) analysis; developing a strategy that fulfills the mission, values, and vision of the organization; determining longterm objectives; selecting key performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress; allocating the necessary budget; rolling out the strategy to the organization; and updating and adapting yearly
g.text: This topic covers concepts such as determining the current organization’s position; performing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats (SWOT) analysis; developing a strategy that fulfills the mission, values, and vision of the organization; determining longterm objectives; selecting key performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress; allocating the necessary budget; rolling out the strategy to the organization; and updating and adapting yearly

g.title: cluster_Strategic planning->Strategic planning_This topic covers concepts such as determining the current organization’s position; performing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats (SWOT) analysis; developing a strategy that fulfills the mission, values, and vision of the organization; determining longterm objectives; selecting key performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress; allocating the necessary budget; rolling out the strategy to the organization; and updating and adapting yearly
cluster_Operational and tactical management
g.text: Operational and tactical management

g.title: Operational and tactical management_The organization ability to securely operate organizational technical infrastructure
g.text: The organization ability to securely operate organizational technical infrastructure

g.title: cluster_Operational and tactical management->Operational and tactical management_The organization ability to securely operate organizational technical infrastructure

Operational and tactical management_This topic includes a discussion of data protection and privacy by default and design, and cover basic concepts, issues, and techniques for efficient and effective operations. Special emphasis is placed on process improvement and supply chain management. Topics include operations strategy; tactical strategy; product and service design; process design and analysis; capacity planning; lean production systems; materials and inventory management; quality management and six sigma; project management; and supply chain management
g.text: This topic includes a discussion of data protection and privacy by default and design, and cover basic concepts, issues, and techniques for efficient and effective operations. Special emphasis is placed on process improvement and supply chain management. Topics include operations strategy; tactical strategy; product and service design; process design and analysis; capacity planning; lean production systems; materials and inventory management; quality management and six sigma; project management; and supply chain management

g.title: cluster_Operational and tactical management->Operational and tactical management_This topic includes a discussion of data protection and privacy by default and design, and cover basic concepts, issues, and techniques for efficient and effective operations. Special emphasis is placed on process improvement and supply chain management. Topics include operations strategy; tactical strategy; product and service design; process design and analysis; capacity planning; lean production systems; materials and inventory management; quality management and six sigma; project management; and supply chain management
cluster_Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management
g.text: Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management

g.title: Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management_Description of the role disaster recovery (DR) plays within business continuity (BC). BC planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation while the disaster recovery refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component
g.text: Description of the role disaster recovery (DR) plays within business continuity (BC). BC planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation while the disaster recovery refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component

g.title: cluster_Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management->Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management_Description of the role disaster recovery (DR) plays within business continuity (BC). BC planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation while the disaster recovery refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component

Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management_This topic includes creation and use of the IR/DR/BP BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, examination of sanitized plans, opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience
g.text: This topic includes creation and use of the IR/DR/BP BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, examination of sanitized plans, opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience

g.title: cluster_Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management->Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, and Incident Management_This topic includes creation and use of the IR/DR/BP BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, examination of sanitized plans, opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience
cluster_Incident response
g.text: Incident response

g.title: Incident response_Incident response (IR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s processes and procedures to anticipate, detect, and mitigate the effects of an incident
g.text: Incident response (IR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s processes and procedures to anticipate, detect, and mitigate the effects of an incident

g.title: cluster_Incident response->Incident response_Incident response (IR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s processes and procedures to anticipate, detect, and mitigate the effects of an incident

Incident response_This topic includes the creation and use of the IR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience
g.text: This topic includes the creation and use of the IR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience

g.title: cluster_Incident response->Incident response_This topic includes the creation and use of the IR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience
cluster_Disaster recovery
g.text: Disaster recovery

g.title: Disaster recovery_Disaster recovery (DR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts in preparation for and recovery from a disaster. Specifically, DR refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster
g.text: Disaster recovery (DR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts in preparation for and recovery from a disaster. Specifically, DR refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster

g.title: cluster_Disaster recovery->Disaster recovery_Disaster recovery (DR) refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts in preparation for and recovery from a disaster. Specifically, DR refers to the recovery of the systems in the event of a disaster

Disaster recovery_This topic includes the creation and use of the DR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience
g.text: This topic includes the creation and use of the DR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience

g.title: cluster_Disaster recovery->Disaster recovery_This topic includes the creation and use of the DR plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write case-based or actual plans to gain some experience
cluster_Business continuity
g.text: Business continuity

g.title: Business continuity_Business continuity refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts if a disaster renders the organization’s primary operating location unusable. Business continuity (BC) planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component
g.text: Business continuity refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts if a disaster renders the organization’s primary operating location unusable. Business continuity (BC) planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component

g.title: cluster_Business continuity->Business continuity_Business continuity refers to the actions taken by senior management to specify the organization’s efforts if a disaster renders the organization’s primary operating location unusable. Business continuity (BC) planning includes contingency planning, incident response, emergency response, and backup and recovery efforts of an organization to ensure the availability of critical resources during an emergency situation. Continuity of organizations in the wake of major events is also a component

Business continuity_Curricular content should include the creation and use of the BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience
g.text: Curricular content should include the creation and use of the BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience

g.title: cluster_Business continuity->Business continuity_Curricular content should include the creation and use of the BC plans, organization of the plans, occasions to review/rewrite plans, and examination of sanitized plans. Opportunities should be given for students to write casebased or actual plans to gain some experience
cluster_Project management
g.text: Project management

g.title: Project management_Project management is the application of knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to project activities to meet the project requirements
g.text: Project management is the application of knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to project activities to meet the project requirements

g.title: cluster_Project management->Project management_Project management is the application of knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to project activities to meet the project requirements

Project management_This topic includes project integration; project scope management; project time and cost management; quality management; human resource considerations; communications; risk management; and procurement management
g.text: This topic includes project integration; project scope management; project time and cost management; quality management; human resource considerations; communications; risk management; and procurement management

g.title: cluster_Project management->Project management_This topic includes project integration; project scope management; project time and cost management; quality management; human resource considerations; communications; risk management; and procurement management
cluster_Resource management
g.text: Resource management

g.title: Resource management_Resource management is the efficient and effective deployment and allocation of an organization’s resources when and where they are needed. Such resources may include financial resources, inventory, human skills, production resources, or information technology
g.text: Resource management is the efficient and effective deployment and allocation of an organization’s resources when and where they are needed. Such resources may include financial resources, inventory, human skills, production resources, or information technology

g.title: cluster_Resource management->Resource management_Resource management is the efficient and effective deployment and allocation of an organization’s resources when and where they are needed. Such resources may include financial resources, inventory, human skills, production resources, or information technology
Resource management_This topic explains and develops current practices in resource management, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity
g.text: This topic explains and develops current practices in resource management, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity

g.title: cluster_Resource management->Resource management_This topic explains and develops current practices in resource management, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity
cluster_Security metrics
g.text: Security metrics

g.title: Security metrics_Metrics, often described as measures, are effective tools to discern the effectiveness of the components of their security programs and drive actions taken to improve a security program
g.text: Metrics, often described as measures, are effective tools to discern the effectiveness of the components of their security programs and drive actions taken to improve a security program

g.title: cluster_Security metrics->Security metrics_Metrics, often described as measures, are effective tools to discern the effectiveness of the components of their security programs and drive actions taken to improve a security program
Security metrics_This topic includes the elements of security metrics, and how to design, develop, validate and organize them. The use of metrics in various contexts should be included such as-
g.text: This topic includes the elements of security metrics, and how to design, develop, validate and organize them. The use of metrics in various contexts should be included such as-

g.title: cluster_Security metrics->Security metrics_This topic includes the elements of security metrics, and how to design, develop, validate and organize them. The use of metrics in various contexts should be included such as-
Security metrics_Use of security metrics in decision making
g.text: Use of security metrics in decision making

g.title: cluster_Security metrics->Security metrics_Use of security metrics in decision making
Security metrics_Use of security metrics in strategic, tactical and operational planning
g.text: Use of security metrics in strategic, tactical and operational planning

g.title: cluster_Security metrics->Security metrics_Use of security metrics in strategic, tactical and operational planning
Security metrics_Use of security metrics in security program evaluation, audition, and performance
g.text: Use of security metrics in security program evaluation, audition, and performance

g.title: cluster_Security metrics->Security metrics_Use of security metrics in security program evaluation, audition, and performance
cluster_Quality assurance and quality control
g.text: Quality assurance and quality control

g.title: Quality assurance and quality control_Quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) are methods used to prevent mistakes which might impact the character of a deliverable such as a software system; control specifically refers to methods used to increase the quality of these systems
g.text: Quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) are methods used to prevent mistakes which might impact the character of a deliverable such as a software system; control specifically refers to methods used to increase the quality of these systems

g.title: cluster_Quality assurance and quality control->Quality assurance and quality control_Quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) are methods used to prevent mistakes which might impact the character of a deliverable such as a software system; control specifically refers to methods used to increase the quality of these systems
Quality assurance and quality control_This topic explains and develop current practices in QA/QC, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity
g.text: This topic explains and develop current practices in QA/QC, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity

g.title: cluster_Quality assurance and quality control->Quality assurance and quality control_This topic explains and develop current practices in QA/QC, specifically in the context of projects typical of cybersecurity
cluster_This topic covers the avoidance and/or proper use of Fear Uncertainty, and Doubt (FUD) as a tool for awareness
g.text: This topic covers the avoidance and/or proper use of Fear Uncertainty, and Doubt (FUD) as a tool for awareness

g.title: cluster_This topic includes physical security; desktop security; password security; wireless networks; security phishing; file sharing and copyright; browsing; encryption; insider threat; international travel; social networking and social engineering
g.text: This topic includes physical security; desktop security; password security; wireless networks; security phishing; file sharing and copyright; browsing; encryption; insider threat; international travel; social networking and social engineering

g.title: cluster_Security hiring practices
g.text: Security hiring practices

g.title: Security hiring practices_The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to recruit, hire and train employees across the organization
g.text: The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to recruit, hire and train employees across the organization

g.title: cluster_Security hiring practices->Security hiring practices_The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to recruit, hire and train employees across the organization

Security hiring practices_This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with a review of fictional resumes, fictional background checks, fictional acted-out interview techniques, fingerprint analysis results, and financial review
g.text: This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with a review of fictional resumes, fictional background checks, fictional acted-out interview techniques, fingerprint analysis results, and financial review

g.title: cluster_Security hiring practices->Security hiring practices_This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with a review of fictional resumes, fictional background checks, fictional acted-out interview techniques, fingerprint analysis results, and financial review
cluster_Security termination practices
g.text: Security termination practices

g.title: Security termination practices_The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to terminate employees across the organization including assigned asset recovery, removal of credentials and proactive prevention of data exfiltration
g.text: The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to terminate employees across the organization including assigned asset recovery, removal of credentials and proactive prevention of data exfiltration

g.title: cluster_Security termination practices->Security termination practices_The practices, governed by policies, used by organizations to terminate employees across the organization including assigned asset recovery, removal of credentials and proactive prevention of data exfiltration
Security termination practices_Students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations
g.text: Students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations

g.title: cluster_Security termination practices->Security termination practices_Students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations
cluster_Third-party security
g.text: Third-party security

g.title: Third-party security_Those practices of firms to manage the risks from contractors, consultants and the staff of key business partners
g.text: Those practices of firms to manage the risks from contractors, consultants and the staff of key business partners

g.title: cluster_Third-party security->Third-party security_Those practices of firms to manage the risks from contractors, consultants and the staff of key business partners
Third-party security_This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations

g.title: cluster_Third-party security->Third-party security_This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations
cluster_Security in review processes
g.text: Security in review processes

g.title: Security in review processes_Those practices of firms to manage the periodic review of staff members
g.text: Those practices of firms to manage the periodic review of staff members

Security in review processes_This topic includes the principles of this topic, and students should gain experience with practice sets and simulations
